tips.title: The 50/30/20 Rule
tips.content:
**The 50/30/20 budgeting rule is a simple way to manage your money:**

- **50% for Needs**: Essential expenses like rent, groceries, utilities
- **30% for Wants**: Entertainment, dining out, hobbies
- **20% for Savings**: Emergency fund, retirement, debt payment

This rule helps ensure you're living within your means while building wealth!

tips.title: Emergency Fund Basics
tips.content:
**An emergency fund is your financial safety net:**

- Aim for 3-6 months of expenses
- Keep it in a separate, easily accessible account
- Only use for true emergencies (job loss, medical bills, major repairs)
- Start small - even $500 can help avoid debt

Building an emergency fund reduces financial stress and prevents debt!

tips.title: Understanding Compound Interest
tips.content:
**Compound interest is the most powerful force in finance:**

- You earn interest on both your original money AND previous interest
- Time is your biggest advantage - start investing early
- Even small amounts compound significantly over time
- Example: $100/month for 30 years at 7% = $121,997!

Einstein called it "the eighth wonder of the world" for good reason!

tips.title: Automating Your Savings
tips.content:
**Did you know? Automating your savings helps build discipline.**

- Set up automatic transfers to savings accounts
- Pay yourself first - save before spending
- Start with just $25/week if money is tight
- Increase the amount by $5 every few months

Automation removes the temptation to spend instead of save!

tips.title: Tracking Your Net Worth
tips.content:
**Net worth = Assets - Liabilities:**

- **Assets**: Cash, investments, property you own
- **Liabilities**: Debts, loans, credit card balances
- Track monthly to see your financial progress
- Focus on increasing assets and decreasing liabilities

Net worth is the best measure of your overall financial health!

tips.title: Smart Credit Card Usage
tips.content:
**Credit cards can be powerful tools when used wisely:**

- Pay the full balance every month to avoid interest
- Keep utilization below 30% of your credit limit
- Use cards for rewards and purchase protection
- Never spend money you don't have

Responsible credit card use builds credit and provides benefits!
